column4: Microsoft to invest in Southeast Asian ride-hailing firm Grab
column5: SINGAPORE  Oct 9 Microsoft Corp is investing in Southeast Asian ride-hailing firm Grab as part of a partnership that the two companies said will allow them to collaborate on technology projects  including big data and artificial intelligence.

Microsoft Corp is testing a new game streaming service called Project xCloud that is designed to work across PCs  consoles and mobile devices  the company said on Monday.

column4: Stay tuned: Fight to lead local TV ad price-fixing MDL is coming right up
column5: There’s absolutely no doubt that the hottest securities class action of the moment is the shareholder fraud case against Tesla over Elon Musk’s infamous $20 million tweet  in which investors have until Tuesday at midnight to file a claim to lead the case. There will undoubtedly be no shortage of candidates  given that plaintiffs’ lawyers have been publicly asserting billion-dollar exposure for Tesla.
